title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Member for Kingsford Smith Matt Thistlethwaite has taken a swipe at the Morrison Government for its drought action, describing it as the government that “doesn’t have a plan”. “When you have towns like Armidale talking about day zero and contingencies of trucking in water, the government needs to start developing plans,” the Labor MP said. “That's why Labor suggested a war-style cabinet where we work on it in a multi-partisan basis. “Let's try and work on this together on a plan to assist some of these rural and regional communities who are really suffering.” Mr Thistlethwaite’s comments come after the National Party leaked the government’s drought strategy in frustration to Sky News.
